intro: Echinocactus saglionis, commonly known as the golden barrel cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its spherical shape and spiny, ribbed structure, which helps it retain water in arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a striking visual contrast to its green body. Its slow growth rate makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation. The thick, waxy cuticle on its surface reduces water loss, adapting it to harsh desert conditions.
